sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Police Training Institute Act.

sections.heading: The trustees of the University of Illinois shall establish a school
sections.text:
to be called the Police Training Institute for the purpose of training
police officers in the State of Illinois in the methods of maintaining
police services at a level consistent with the needs of the community. The
training offered in the Police Training Institute shall be under the
direction of the Office of the Provost and Vice Chancellor for Academic Affairs at the
University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sections.heading: Enrollment and attendance at the Institute shall be limited to duly
sections.text:
appointed members of legally constituted police agencies of the State of
Illinois to include state, county, city, park district and village officers
selected by the commanding officer of the police agency involved.

sections.heading: The sum of $30,000.00 or so much thereof as may be necessary
sections.text:
is appropriated to the trustees of the University of Illinois for the
purpose of carrying out the provisions of this Act.
